resources.string: Recommendations for people to contact based on your message history

Lemur is the result of a four people group project in the course Mobile Applications, taken in Västerås on Mälardalen University. 

The objective was to create a working application for a mobile device. One requirement was to use at least one of the phones sensors. For a higher grade the application also had to be fully operational without bugs and with a user friendly interface. 

Lemur is a fun measurement tool right in your phone. We took the requirement for at least one sensor to the next level. We decided to use as many as we had time to implement. Lemur allows the user to apply the phones different sensors and features for other things than was originally intended. Want to measure the sound intensity in the room? Or maybe see how high above the sea level you are at the moment? Lemur can do it. 

Lemur is not meant to be used as a serious measurement tool and might not always display the exact value.

Soon to be AWESOME, descriptive and helpful content!

Decibel will measure the sound intensity recorded by the microphone and display it in decibel. 

Decibel is not meant to be used as a serious measurement tool and might not display the exact right value. 

Since different phones can have a wide variety of different microphones implemented this function can only display an estimate that might differ from phone to phone. To be sure the value is right each phone would need to have the exact same hardware installed or be individually calibrated by more advanced equipment to be sure that they measure exactly right.
